value.name: [2106.01231] RX J0123.4-7321 -- the story continues: major ...
value.snippet: RX J0123.4-7321 is a well-established Be star X-ray binary system (BeXRB) in the Small Magellanic Cloud (SMC). Like many such systems the variable X-ray emission is driven by the underlying behaviour of the mass donor Be star.

value.name: RX J0123.4-7321 - the story continues: major circumstellar disc loss ...
value.snippet: RX J0123.4-7321 is a well-established Be star X-ray binary system in the Small Magellanic Cloud. Like many such systems, the variable X-ray emission is driven by the underlying behaviour of the mass donor Be star. Previous work has shown that the optical and X-ray were characterized by regular outbursts at the proposed binary period of 119 d.

value.name: RX J0123.4-7321, a Be/X-ray binary in the wing of the Small Magellanic ...
value.snippet: We found that RX J0123.4-7321 was much brighter when detected with ROSAT than seen 16 years later by XMM-Newton. Methods: We analysed the ROSAT observations and the OGLE I-band light curve of the optical counterpart to investigate the nature of the system. Results: High long-term variability in the X-ray flux of a factor of ~150 was found between the ROSAT and XMM-Newton detections, indicating strong outburst activity during the ROSAT observations.
